intro: Lefebvrea nigeriae, commonly known as the Nigerian leafeater, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in swampy areas. Its flowers are pollinated by insects, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Lefebvrea nigeriae is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in some local communities.
